newsitem.title: USA: USWC prods rise ahead of Thurs crude unit shutdown.
newsitem.headline: USWC prods rise ahead of Thurs crude unit shutdown.

text.p: Idling prices for U.S. West Coast products got a boost Wednesday afternoon from news that Unocal Corp of California would shut part of a refinery that helps converts crude oil into gasolines and distillates.
Operators plan to shut a 125,000 barrel per day crude unit at the company's Los Angeles-area refinery on Thursday , a spokesman said.
Conventional-grade gasoline in Los Angeles rose 0.50 - 1.00 cent late Wednesday to 65.50/66.50 cents a gallon.
